Legendary computer game Counter-Strike was not just No. 1 in the list of top game experience and has evolved over almost 15 years, which is rarely seen with the top games. Few, to say the least, unsuccessful attempts to do something new on the basis of the old were "booed" even devoted fans Counter-Strike. The comments of the players finally were heard by the developers who created something worthy in Counter-Strike 1.6.

IMMUTABLE STORY

The game scenario is built on the confrontation between special forces and terrorists. Each of them has its own task: the first or to release the hostages, or defuse a place where that's the bomb detonates, and the second is to do everything that the police are unable to carry out their tasks.

The terrain in each of the different battles. On a special map sections, prefixed to the name to identify the task for each team:

"de_" ‚Äî fighting special operations task is to search and neutralization of explosives, planted by a terrorist group;
"cs_" ‚Äî gangster Kubla are hostages in need of rescue, without compromising;
"as_" in the area of salvation it is necessary to deliver "an important person", shielding her from the bullets of bandits and protecting from theft.
At the end of the battle players cs 1.6 receive a virtual monetary reward, which is usually not embedded in noisy revelry, as happens in life, and in updating and completion of the work Arsenal and/or improving protective equipment.

For those who want Counter-Strike to download, no need to worry about the systematic upgrading versions or installing additional extensions, because all the scenarios, subject of the plot, location and mode of operation programmed initially.

Two terrorists in Counter-Strike 1.6

THE NUANCES OF THE GAME

The first version of the game was the network, but with the proliferation of home PCs has become quite easy to download it via Torrents. Broadband Internet access allows you to attack strategic targets with a real team. There is a mode and single player, where teammates will be bots.

Choose your character in the valiant team of commandos and a daring group of terrorists. But in the updated version there are several times more different types of weapons. For example, is now available stun grenade and a Molotov cocktail. Expanded Arsenal of guns. The changed tariff of remuneration: in version CS 1.6 player for the neutralization of the enemy with outdated weapons gets more money. This is true because the gamers of this class the ability to fight more valuable compared to a player who becomes a hero with the tech cannon.

its the one of first greatest online multiplayer game with that sort of gameplay.

One of the most remarkable things about Counter-Strike, from around the time the PC version first started getting popular, was how its amateur developers completely redid not only the graphics of Half-Life but also the sound. And they did a superb job of it. Audio has always played a key role in CS, since each weapon has its own, distinctive report, and it's possible to hear the footsteps of players who are running--as opposed to inching--their ways forward. It's a testament to the original developers' efforts that Counter-Strike for the Xbox, despite recycling all of those five-year-old sound effects, still sounds pretty good. Actually, though, it's also pretty embarrassing that no one bothered to update this game's audio in the process of translating it to the Xbox. For what it's worth, there's a new effect for when grenades detonate near your character. You'll now hear a simulated ringing in your ears, though the effect isn't as convincing as comparable effects found in other, similar games.

Ironically, the biggest competition that this Xbox version of Counter-Strike faces is from itself. In particular, the new Counter-Strike must compete against the aging PC version of Counter-Strike that's still free, still widely played, and still runs faster than ever on today's average system. Meanwhile, judged solely on its own merits or against standards established by other Xbox shooters, this game has a very limited variety of modes of play (including barely any single-player component to speak of) and contains underachieving production qualities that will disappoint those expecting anything more than just a port of an old PC shooter. Despite all that and despite the suboptimal controls for a game demanding of down-to-the-pixel precision, the gameplay of Counter-Strike still shines through as a finely tuned combination of addictive arcade action and deeply strategic teamwork. It's too bad, though, that the underlying high quality of the gameplay isn't more readily apparent. Pub and automix servers are also the reason why cs 1.6 exists still.
